title: Fuel Tank Trim Panels - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
This assembly procedure makes sure the gap between fuel tank and infill panel is small and consistent.
The gap should be visually checked on both sides of the fuel tank to make sure it is even.
When the tank is fitted to the frame it is important to check there is sufficient gap between the frame and the fuel tank trim panels.
The left and right rubber stand offs slot onto the fuel tank seam before the fuel tank trim panels are fitted.
Fit the rubber stand off's to the lower edge of the fuel tank.
The S-Clips must be pushed in and fully fit to the tabs once only.
The S-clips deform the plastic to create a one time fit.
If the S-Clips need to be removed, the fuel tank trim panels must also be replaced.
The S-clips must be attached with the flat face on the inside of the infill panel.
This is the narrower slot of the S-Clip and must be only used on the plastic faces.
The larger slot must only be fitted to the edge of the fuel tank edge.
Position the S-clip to the fuel tank trim panel so that the edge of the flat face is closest to the thickest edge of the tab.
The two pre-assembled fuel tank trim panels need to be loosely attached to the fuel tank using the two fixings.
This allows both fuel tank trim panels to rotate away from the tank in order to fit the front infill rubber.
Position the infill panels to the fuel tank and fit the left and right hand fixings. DO NOT fully tighten at this stage.
Rotate the infill panels away from the fuel tank and fit the front infill rubber into the locating tabs on the fuel tank trim panels as shown.
Slide the rubber trims into the locating tabs on the fuel tank trim panels.
Align the assembled trim panels centrally onto the front of the fuel tank front seam of the fuel tank.
The complete assembly can then be rotated down into position.
Align the S-Clips and push onto the tank seam.
Push down the front infill rubber onto the front edge of the tank seam in its centrally aligned position.
Do not allow the infill panels to come into contact with the edges of the recessed area during the final torque tightening procedure.
Always securely hold the infill panels in position during the tightening procedure.
Failure to hold the panels in position may cause the panels to crack causing irreparable cosmetic damage to the panels.
Once the assembly is securely positioned onto the tank hold the infill panels into their final position.
Position the fixing into the center of the recessed area and tighten both sides to
Position the front tank bracket to the fuel tank.
Fit the flanged sleeves and the bushes.
